snippet: Even as he faces escalating attacks for his stance toward charter schools, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday neared securing state funding to expand prekindergarten in New York City.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio steps closer to securing state financing to expand prekindergarten, even as he comes under escalating attacks from Gov Andrew M Cuomo and the Legislature for his stance on charter schools; financing will likely be state money, rather than coming from a tax increase on wealthy residents.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan reported from Albany, and Al Baker from New York.

lead_paragraph: Even as he faces escalating attacks for his stance toward charter schools, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday neared securing state funding to expand prekindergarten in New York City.

headline.main: De Blasio Closes In on Pre-K Funding, but Not From a Higher Tax
headline.print_headline: Mayor Closes In on Pre-K Funding, but Not From a Higher Tax
